alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:43PM MST until July 25 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... central Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 945 PM MST. * At 642 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain north of Houck, from Pine Springs to Wide Ruins. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine Springs, Wide Ruins. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 345 and 347. Highway 191 near mile marker 387. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bent Knee Wash, Puerco River, Oak Ridge Wash, Burntwater Wash, West Fork Black Creek, Wide Ruin Wash and Black Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
